TopicTitle: What is the most underrated planet/moon/star?

Articles.Content:
In my opinion Dres is the most underrated planet, no one ever talks about it and i never even knew it existed until i zoomed in while using the map.

This thread would be a poll but the maximum options are 10 so i can't.

Also, when i said star i only meant Kerbol.

Edited December 15, 2013 by Astronaut
Kerbin.jbh

The most underrated star in KSP is either Kerbal or that one star a little bit below the KSP equivalent of the Milky Way, right next to that big weird red star.

???

I agree about Dres. The canyon on the planet is huge if you ever get to go there.

It looks like this little shallow scratch on the surface when you observe from orbital view, but DAMN that thing is pretty sweet.

... also, super hard to get an intercept with ... and it's a little scary O.O

Kerbin.jbh

I agree, soooo many interesting places yet no one bothers to explore it!

Either Dres or Ike. You can't help it but love Ike.

I actually hated it. It's a mission killer, and always gets on the way.

I've only sent one probe mission there.

I agree, soooo many interesting places yet no one bothers to explore it!

Unfortunately, it's the water-lag on Kerbin that puts so many people (myself included) off exploring it (I hear that this may have been fixed in 0.23... I sincerely hope so, too!). I do agree though, it has many interesting locations, one of my favourites being the pine forests at the boundary of the south polar ice cap. Very, very pretty place

I also agree with Dres being underrated. I'd say Moho is underrated, but everyone is obsessed with the moholes, while I've only landed on the planet once and failed to put a probe in orbit, instead committing the little machine to two flybys of the innermost planet. Having recently landed on Dres for the second time, I can tell you that the only interesting feature I know of is the group of canyons/scars. I will get around to other locations eventually, but none will compare.

astropapi1, are you using some sort of graphics/texture mod? That Duna looks so much... prettier than I'm used to...

Then again, having only been to Duna something on the order of twice, maybe I'm just not familiar with how it looks...

Oh, It's just the cloud pack for UniverseReplacer.

I agree with Kerbin. The mountains halfway between KSC and the north pole are gorgeous.

Although it's edited, I think that Nassault's video

outlines pretty clearly why Kerbin gets my vote. However, perhaps with added dynamic features (Weather, geysers, magma flows etc...) the other planets could catch up.

Pol.

I dunno why but I love Pol. No one ever goes to Pol, they always get distracted by Laythe.
Gilly, I'm not even sure what planet is its parent!

Gilly, I'm not even sure what planet is its parent!

what if... gilly was adopted?

Edited December 15, 2013 by vexx32
Reaction image snip.
My vote goes to Pol. Ike is close second.
I'm warming to Moho. Loads of launch windows, short flight time, easy to land on. Might build a station there soon.

The OP mentioned planet/moon/star and imo technically Dres does not qualify because it is an asteroid/dwarf planet, very much like it's real-life counterpart Ceres.

JK aside, I think Dres is underrated. I have sent EDIT: am sending a rover to Dres (my first mission to Dres), but .23 is coming out soon, so hard to choose between updating or completing my mission first

Edited December 16, 2013 by manskal

I think Eeloo is pretty underrated. Most people only see it as the farthest planet and that there's no real reason to go there, but it's fun to explore and has some things going for it. Eeloo is the lowest gravity place that you can still sprint on, it has the shortest rotational period of any object in the game, and if you see the sun from Eeloo's apoapsis it's quite a sight(it's my profile pic). Just don't let the kerbals get into snowball fights while you're exploring.

...and if you see the sun from Eeloo's apoapsis it's quite a sight(it's my profile pic). Just don't let the kerbals get into snowball fights while you're exploring.

Well, there's not much to see from that tiny picture. Could you post it here?

I think Gilly is under-rated.

Nobody ever mentions it, but I think it's really pretty. It has a dense boulder-field all over it, and has a view of the beautiful eve.

It's easy to get to, and unlike most planets and moons, a simple mission can tour the entire place, either with about 50dv of fuel, or just using EVA jetpacks.
Dres, I always forget that planet actually exists...
Probably Kerbin. Not many people explore its detailed scenery, mostly because of the horizon lag.
What is this Dres planet everyone is talking about?
Pol. A fun little moon that gets overlooked...
No one ever remembers Vall

Pol. A fun little moon that gets overlooked...

I literally just landed there for the first time. That thing is loads of fun. I need to get a rover there.
